cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 171, Number 41 (Tuesday, March 4, 2025)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McGOVERN:H.R. 1834.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H976]

item.name: Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs Subcommittee
Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1834) to advance policy priorities that will break the gridlock.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 319.
Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Received in the Senate.
Senate returned papers to the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Senate returned papers to House by Unanimous Consent.
House requested return of papers pursuant to H. Res. 991
Received in the Senate.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 196 (Roll no. 11). (text of amendment in the nature of a substitute: CR H213-217)
Passed/agreed to in House: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 196 (Roll no. 11). (text of amendment in the nature of a substitute: CR H213-217)
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1834.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 780. (consideration: CR H213-227)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.

Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committees on Natural Resources, House Administration, Transportation and Infrastructure, Agriculture, Science, Space, and Technology, Education and Workforce, Foreign Affairs, Intelligence (Permanent Select), Small Business, the Judiciary, Homeland Security, Financial Services, Veterans' Affairs, Ways and Means, Rules, Ethics, Energy and Commerce, the Budget, Oversight and Government Reform, and Appropriations, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

amendment.description: Pursuant to the provisions of H.Res. 780, the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the Congressional Record of November 12, 2025 is considered adopted.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
